context: Super Bowl 50 was an American football game to determine the champion of the National Football League (NFL) for the 2015 season. The American Football Conference (AFC) champion Denver Broncos defeated the National Football Conference (NFC) champion Carolina Panthers 24–10 to earn their third Super Bowl title. The game was played on February 7, 2016, at Levi's Stadium in the San Francisco Bay Area at Santa Clara, California. As this was the 50th Super Bowl, the league emphasized the 'golden anniversary' with various gold-themed initiatives, as well as temporarily suspending the tradition of naming each Super Bowl game with Roman numerals (under which the game would have been known as 'Super Bowl L'), so that the logo could prominently feature the Arabic numerals 50.

They also made the unique decision to temporarily break tradition and forgo the Roman numerals typically used to name each Super Bowl game. Instead, the Arabic numeral 50 was prominently featured in the logo for this special edition of the game..

context: The league announced on October 16, 2012, that the two finalists were Sun Life Stadium and Levi's Stadium. The South Florida/Miami area has previously hosted the event 10 times (tied for most with New Orleans), with the most recent one being Super Bowl XLIV in 2010. The San Francisco Bay Area last hosted in 1985 (Super Bowl XIX), held at Stanford Stadium in Stanford, California, won by the home team 49ers. The Miami bid depended on whether the stadium underwent renovations. However, on May 3, 2013, the Florida legislature refused to approve the funding plan to pay for the renovations, dealing a significant blow to Miami's chances.

context: For the third straight season, the number one seeds from both conferences met in the Super Bowl. The Carolina Panthers became one of only ten teams to have completed a regular season with only one loss, and one of only six teams to have acquired a 15–1 record, while the Denver Broncos became one of four teams to have made eight appearances in the Super Bowl. The Broncos made their second Super Bowl appearance in three years, having reached Super Bowl XLVIII, while the Panthers made their second Super Bowl appearance in franchise history, their other appearance being Super Bowl XXXVIII. Coincidentally, both teams were coached by John Fox in their last Super Bowl appearance prior to Super Bowl 50.
modContext: In a trend that has continued for three consecutive seasons, the top-ranked teams from both conferences came face to face in the Super Bowl..The Carolina Panthers made history as they joined an exclusive group of only ten teams to finish a regular season with just one loss. Additionally, they achieved a remarkable 15-1 record, placing them among the elite few teams to accomplish this feat. On the other hand, the Denver Broncos solidified their place in football history by becoming one of four teams to have made eight appearances in the Super Bowl..The Broncos advanced to their second Super Bowl in three years after previously making it to Super Bowl XLVIII. Similarly, the Panthers also made their second Super Bowl appearance, with their first being in Super Bowl XXXVIII, marking a milestone in the history of their franchise..Interestingly, both teams had the guidance of John Fox when they last appeared in the Super Bowl before Super Bowl 50..

context: Despite waiving longtime running back DeAngelo Williams and losing top wide receiver Kelvin Benjamin to a torn ACL in the preseason, the Carolina Panthers had their best regular season in franchise history, becoming the seventh team to win at least 15 regular season games since the league expanded to a 16-game schedule in 1978. Carolina started the season 14–0, not only setting franchise records for the best start and the longest single-season winning streak, but also posting the best start to a season by an NFC team in NFL history, breaking the 13–0 record previously shared with the 2009 New Orleans Saints and the 2011 Green Bay Packers. With their NFC-best 15–1 regular season record, the Panthers clinched home-field advantage throughout the NFC playoffs for the first time in franchise history. Ten players were selected to the Pro Bowl (the most in franchise history) along with eight All-Pro selections.
modContext: Despite the release of veteran running back DeAngelo Williams and the injury of top wide receiver Kelvin Benjamin in the preseason, the Carolina Panthers had an outstanding regular season, achieving their best performance in franchise history. This accomplishment placed them among the elite group of only seven teams to win at least 15 games during a regular season since the NFL adopted a 16-game schedule in 1978..Carolina's impressive season began with a remarkable 14–0 record. This outstanding start not only established new franchise records for the best start and longest winning streak in a single season, but also marked the best start to a season by any NFC team in NFL history. This remarkable achievement surpassed the previous record of 13–0 held jointly by the 2009 New Orleans Saints and the 2011 Green Bay Packers..For the first time in franchise history, the Panthers secured home-field advantage throughout the NFC playoffs with their impressive 15-1 regular season record, the best in the NFC..A total of ten players, the highest number ever for the franchise, were chosen for the Pro Bowl, in addition to earning eight All-Pro selections..
question: Whic Carolina Panthers running back was waived?

context: Despite waiving longtime running back DeAngelo Williams and losing top wide receiver Kelvin Benjamin to a torn ACL in the preseason, the Carolina Panthers had their best regular season in franchise history, becoming the seventh team to win at least 15 regular season games since the league expanded to a 16-game schedule in 1978. Carolina started the season 14–0, not only setting franchise records for the best start and the longest single-season winning streak, but also posting the best start to a season by an NFC team in NFL history, breaking the 13–0 record previously shared with the 2009 New Orleans Saints and the 2011 Green Bay Packers. With their NFC-best 15–1 regular season record, the Panthers clinched home-field advantage throughout the NFC playoffs for the first time in franchise history. Ten players were selected to the Pro Bowl (the most in franchise history) along with eight All-Pro selections.
modContext: Despite the release of veteran running back DeAngelo Williams and the injury of top wide receiver Kelvin Benjamin in the preseason, the Carolina Panthers had an outstanding regular season, achieving their best performance in franchise history. This accomplishment placed them among the elite group of only seven teams to win at least 15 games during a regular season since the NFL adopted a 16-game schedule in 1978..Carolina's impressive season began with a remarkable 14–0 record. This outstanding start not only established new franchise records for the best start and longest winning streak in a single season, but also marked the best start to a season by any NFC team in NFL history. This remarkable achievement surpassed the previous record of 13–0 held jointly by the 2009 New Orleans Saints and the 2011 Green Bay Packers..For the first time in franchise history, the Panthers secured home-field advantage throughout the NFC playoffs with their impressive 15-1 regular season record, the best in the NFC..A total of ten players, the highest number ever for the franchise, were chosen for the Pro Bowl, in addition to earning eight All-Pro selections..

context: The Panthers defense gave up just 308 points, ranking sixth in the league, while also leading the NFL in interceptions with 24 and boasting four Pro Bowl selections. Pro Bowl defensive tackle Kawann Short led the team in sacks with 11, while also forcing three fumbles and recovering two. Fellow lineman Mario Addison added 6½ sacks. The Panthers line also featured veteran defensive end Jared Allen, a 5-time pro bowler who was the NFL's active career sack leader with 136, along with defensive end Kony Ealy, who had 5 sacks in just 9 starts. Behind them, two of the Panthers three starting linebackers were also selected to play in the Pro Bowl: Thomas Davis and Luke Kuechly. Davis compiled 5½ sacks, four forced fumbles, and four interceptions, while Kuechly led the team in tackles (118) forced two fumbles, and intercepted four passes of his own. Carolina's secondary featured Pro Bowl safety Kurt Coleman, who led the team with a career high seven interceptions, while also racking up 88 tackles and Pro Bowl cornerback Josh Norman, who developed into a shutdown corner during the season and had four interceptions, two of which were returned for touchdowns.

question: How many interceptions did Josh Norman score touchdowns with in 2015?

context: Following their loss in the divisional round of the previous season's playoffs, the Denver Broncos underwent numerous coaching changes, including a mutual parting with head coach John Fox (who had won four divisional championships in his four years as Broncos head coach), and the hiring of Gary Kubiak as the new head coach. Under Kubiak, the Broncos planned to install a run-oriented offense with zone blocking to blend in with quarterback Peyton Manning's shotgun passing skills, but struggled with numerous changes and injuries to the offensive line, as well as Manning having his worst statistical season since his rookie year with the Indianapolis Colts in 1998, due to a plantar fasciitis injury in his heel that he had suffered since the summer, and the simple fact that Manning was getting old, as he turned 39 in the 2015 off-season. Although the team had a 7–0 start, Manning led the NFL in interceptions. In week 10, Manning suffered a partial tear of the plantar fasciitis in his left foot. He set the NFL's all-time record for career passing yards in this game, but was benched after throwing four interceptions in favor of backup quarterback Brock Osweiler, who took over as the starter for most of the remainder of the regular season. Osweiler was injured, however, leading to Manning's return during the Week 17 regular season finale, where the Broncos were losing 13–7 against the 4–11 San Diego Chargers, resulting in Manning re-claiming the starting quarterback position for the playoffs by leading the team to a key 27–20 win that enabled the team to clinch the number one overall AFC seed. Under defensive coordinator Wade Phillips, the Broncos' defense ranked number one in total yards allowed, passing yards allowed and sacks, and like the previous three seasons, the team has continued to set numerous individual, league and franchise records. With the defense carrying the team despite the issues with the offense, the Broncos finished the regular season with a 12–4 record and earned home-field advantage throughout the AFC playoffs.
modContext: After the Denver Broncos suffered a defeat in the divisional round of the playoffs last season, they made several adjustments to their coaching staff. This included parting ways with head coach John Fox, who had achieved four divisional championships during his four-year tenure with the Broncos. Under Kubiak, the Broncos planned to install a run-oriented offense with zone blocking to blend in with quarterback Peyton Manning's shotgun passing skills, but struggled with numerous changes and injuries to the offensive line, as well as Manning having his worst statistical season since his rookie year with the Indianapolis Colts in 1998, due to a plantar fasciitis injury in his heel that he had suffered since the summer, and the simple fact that Manning was getting old, as he turned 39 in the 2015 off-season. Although the team had a 7–0 start, Manning led the NFL in interceptions. In week 10, Manning suffered a partial tear of the plantar fasciitis in his left foot. He set the NFL's all-time record for career passing yards in this game, but was benched after throwing four interceptions in favor of backup quarterback Brock Osweiler, who took over as the starter for most of the remainder of the regular season. Osweiler was injured, however, leading to Manning's return during the Week 17 regular season finale, where the Broncos were losing 13–7 against the 4–11 San Diego Chargers, resulting in Manning re-claiming the starting quarterback position for the playoffs by leading the team to a key 27–20 win that enabled the team to clinch the number one overall AFC seed. Under defensive coordinator Wade Phillips, the Broncos' defense ranked number one in total yards allowed, passing yards allowed and sacks, and like the previous three seasons, the team has continued to set numerous individual, league and franchise records. With the defense carrying the team despite the issues with the offense, the Broncos finished the regular season with a 12–4 record and earned home-field advantage throughout the AFC playoffs.
modContext: After the Denver Broncos suffered a defeat in the divisional round of the playoffs last season, they made several adjustments to their coaching staff. This included parting ways with head coach John Fox, who had achieved four divisional championships during his four-year tenure with the Broncos. In his place, the team hired Gary Kubiak as the new head coach..During Kubiak's tenure, the Broncos intended to implement a run-focused offense that incorporated zone blocking to complement quarterback Peyton Manning's expertise in shotgun passing. However, they faced difficulties due to multiple modifications and injuries to the offensive line. Additionally, Manning experienced his least successful season in terms of statistics since his rookie year in 1998 with the Indianapolis Colts. This decline was partly attributed to a plantar fasciitis injury in his heel that he had been dealing with since the summer and the natural aging process, as Manning turned 39 during the 2015 off-season..Despite the team's impressive 7-0 start, Manning topped the NFL in interceptions..Manning's left foot experienced a partial tear of the plantar fasciitis in week 10..In this game, he achieved the remarkable feat of setting the NFL's all-time record for career passing yards. However, his performance took a downturn when he threw four interceptions, leading to his replacement by backup quarterback Brock Osweiler. From that point onwards, Osweiler took over as the starting quarterback for the majority of the remaining regular season..During the Week 17 regular season finale, Osweiler suffered an injury which led to Manning's return. At that time, the Broncos were trailing 13-7 against the San Diego Chargers, who had a record of 4-11. Manning stepped in and managed to lead the team to a crucial 27-20 victory. This win allowed the Broncos to secure the number one overall AFC seed and ensured Manning's reclamation of the starting quarterback position for the playoffs..With Wade Phillips as the defensive coordinator, the Broncos' defense excelled in various aspects including total yards allowed, passing yards allowed, and sacks, ranking them number one. Furthermore, the team has consistently established numerous individual, league, and franchise records for the past three seasons..Despite the offensive struggles, the Broncos relied on their strong defense to carry the team throughout the regular season. As a result, they finished with an impressive 12-4 record and secured home-field advantage for the AFC playoffs..

context: The Broncos' defense ranked first in the NFL yards allowed (4,530) for the first time in franchise history, and fourth in points allowed (296). Defensive ends Derek Wolfe and Malik Jackson each had 5½ sacks. Pro Bowl linebacker Von Miller led the team with 11 sacks, forced four fumbles, and recovered three. Linebacker DeMarcus Ware was selected to play in the Pro Bowl for the ninth time in his career, ranking second on the team with 7½ sacks. Linebacker Brandon Marshall led the team in total tackles with 109, while Danny Trevathan ranked second with 102. Cornerbacks Aqib Talib (three interceptions) and Chris Harris, Jr. (two interceptions) were the other two Pro Bowl selections from the defense.

context: Concerns were raised over whether Levi's Stadium's field was of a high enough quality to host a Super Bowl; during the inaugural season, the field had to be re-sodded multiple times due to various issues, and during a week 6 game earlier in the 2015 season, a portion of the turf collapsed under Baltimore Ravens kicker Justin Tucker, causing him to slip and miss a field goal, although the field has not had any major issues since. As is customary for Super Bowl games played at natural grass stadiums, the NFL re-sodded the field with a new playing surface; a hybrid Bermuda 419 turf. NFL and Atlanta Braves field director Ed Mangan stated that the field was in 'great shape' for gameday. However, the turf showed problem throughout the game, with a number of players needing to change their cleats during the game and player slipping during plays all throughout the game.
modContext: There were doubts surrounding the suitability of Levi's Stadium's field for hosting a Super Bowl. In its first season, the field had to be re-sodded multiple times due to various problems. Additionally, during a week 6 game in 2015, a section of the turf gave way under Justin Tucker, the Baltimore Ravens kicker, leading to his slip and a missed field goal. context: As the designated home team in the annual rotation between AFC and NFC teams, the Broncos elected to wear their road white jerseys with matching white pants. Elway stated, 'We've had Super Bowl success in our white uniforms.' The Broncos last wore matching white jerseys and pants in the Super Bowl in Super Bowl XXXIII, Elway's last game as Denver QB, when they defeated the Atlanta Falcons 34–19. In their only other Super Bowl win in Super Bowl XXXII, Denver wore blue jerseys, which was their primary color at the time. They also lost Super Bowl XXI when they wore white jerseys, but they are 0-4 in Super Bowls when wearing orange jerseys, losing in Super Bowl XII, XXII, XXIV, and XLVIII. The only other AFC champion team to have worn white as the designated home team in the Super Bowl was the Pittsburgh Steelers; they defeated the Seattle Seahawks 21–10 in Super Bowl XL 10 seasons prior. The Broncos' decision to wear white meant the Panthers would wear their standard home uniform: black jerseys with silver pants.
modContext: The Broncos, who were chosen as the home team in the yearly rotation, made the decision to wear their white away jerseys and coordinated white pants..According to Elway, the team has achieved Super Bowl success while wearing their white uniforms..The last time the Broncos donned coordinated white jerseys and pants in a Super Bowl was during Super Bowl XXXIII. This game also marked John Elway's final appearance as quarterback for Denver. The Broncos emerged victorious, triumphing over the Atlanta Falcons with a final score of 34-19..During their sole victory in Super Bowl XXXII, Denver Broncos donned blue jerseys, reflecting their predominant color choice during that period..In addition to the loss in Super Bowl XXI while wearing white jerseys, the team has a winless record of 0-4 in Super Bowls when wearing orange jerseys. Their losses came in Super Bowl XII, XXII, XXIV, and XLVIII..The Pittsburgh Steelers were the only other AFC champion team to wear white as the designated home team in the Super Bowl. They won Super Bowl XL against the Seattle Seahawks with a score of 21-10, 10 seasons earlier..The Panthers' standard home uniform consists of black jerseys with silver pants. As a result of the Broncos deciding to wear white, the Panthers will be donning their usual attire..

context: On June 4, 2014, the NFL announced that the practice of branding Super Bowl games with Roman numerals, a practice established at Super Bowl V, would be temporarily suspended, and that the game would be named using Arabic numerals as Super Bowl 50 as opposed to Super Bowl L. The use of Roman numerals will be reinstated for Super Bowl LI. Jaime Weston, the league's vice president of brand and creative, explained that a primary reason for the change was the difficulty of designing an aesthetically pleasing logo with the letter 'L' using the standardized logo template introduced at Super Bowl XLV. The logo also deviates from the template by featuring large numerals, colored in gold, behind the Vince Lombardi Trophy, instead of underneath and in silver as in the standard logo.
modContext: The NFL put a temporary halt to the tradition of using Roman numerals to brand Super Bowl games, starting from Super Bowl V. Instead, they announced that the game would be named Super Bowl 50, using Arabic numerals. This change was announced on June 4, 2014.Super Bowl LI will see the reintroduction of Roman numerals..The league's vice president of brand and creative, Jaime Weston, cited the challenge of creating an attractive logo using the standardized template introduced at Super Bowl XLV as one of the main reasons for the change..In contrast to the standard logo, the logo also diverges by incorporating prominent gold-colored numerals behind the Vince Lombardi Trophy, instead of positioning them underneath and in silver as per the template..
question: When did the NFL announce the suspension of using Roman numerals to brand the Super Bowl?

context: On June 4, 2014, the NFL announced that the practice of branding Super Bowl games with Roman numerals, a practice established at Super Bowl V, would be temporarily suspended, and that the game would be named using Arabic numerals as Super Bowl 50 as opposed to Super Bowl L. The use of Roman numerals will be reinstated for Super Bowl LI. Jaime Weston, the league's vice president of brand and creative, explained that a primary reason for the change was the difficulty of designing an aesthetically pleasing logo with the letter 'L' using the standardized logo template introduced at Super Bowl XLV. The logo also deviates from the template by featuring large numerals, colored in gold, behind the Vince Lombardi Trophy, instead of underneath and in silver as in the standard logo.
modContext: The NFL put a temporary halt to the tradition of using Roman numerals to brand Super Bowl games, starting from Super Bowl V. Instead, they announced that the game would be named Super Bowl 50, using Arabic numerals. This change was announced on June 4, 2014.Super Bowl LI will see the reintroduction of Roman numerals..The league's vice president of brand and creative, Jaime Weston, cited the challenge of creating an attractive logo using the standardized template introduced at Super Bowl XLV as one of the main reasons for the change..In contrast to the standard logo, the logo also diverges by incorporating prominent gold-colored numerals behind the Vince Lombardi Trophy, instead of positioning them underneath and in silver as per the template..
question: What was the first Super Bowl branded with Roman numerals?

context: Various gold-themed promotions and initiatives were held throughout the 2015 NFL season to tie into the 'Golden Super Bowl'; gold-tinted logos were implemented across the NFL's properties and painted on fields, the numbering of the 50-yard line on fields was colored gold, and beginning on week 7, all sideline jackets and hats featured gold-trimmed logos. Gold footballs were given to each high school that has had a player or coach appear in the Super Bowl, and 'homecoming' events were also held by Super Bowl-winning teams at games.
modContext: To align with the 'Golden Super Bowl' theme, the 2015 NFL season witnessed a range of promotions and initiatives related to gold. As part of this, gold-tinted logos were applied to various NFL properties and fields. Additionally, the numbering on the 50-yard line of the fields was colored gold. From the seventh week onwards, sideline jackets and hats were adorned with gold-trimmed logos..Super Bowl-winning teams celebrated their triumphs by organizing 'homecoming' events during games and awarding gold footballs to high schools that had players or coaches who had appeared in the Super Bowl..

In addition, 'Super Bowl City' opened on January 30 at Justin Herman Plaza on The Embarcadero, featuring games and activities that will highlight the Bay Area's technology, culinary creations, and cultural diversity. More than 1 million people are expected to attend the festivities in San Francisco during Super Bowl Week. San Francisco city supervisor Jane Kim unsuccessfully lobbied for the NFL to reimburse San Francisco for city services in the amount of $5 million.
